message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a one-of-a-kind opportunity to own something truly special. I'm willing to sell it to you for $9500. What do you think?
Thanks for the offer, Alice! I'm interested, but $9500 is a bit higher than I'm comfortable with right now.  I'd be willing to pay $7000 for the product.  What do you think?
Thank you for your offer, Bob! I understand your concerns, but I'm not willing to go as low as $7000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $8200. What do you think?
Alice, I appreciate you meeting me halfway, but $8200 is still a bit more than I can do right now.  I'm willing to go up to $7500.  This is my final offer. What do you think?

I understand that you're willing to go up to $7500, Bob, but I'm still not comfortable selling it to you at that price. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and offer it to you for $8100. This is my final counteroffer. What do you think?
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $8100 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to go up to $7800.  If we can't reach an agreement, I'll have to consider other options.

I understand that you're willing to go up to $7800, Bob, but I'm still not comfortable selling it to you at that price. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and offer it to you for $8050. This is my final counteroffer. What do you think?

Alice, I appreciate you meeting me halfway again, but $8050 is still a bit more than I'm comfortable with.  I'm willing to go up to $7900, which is really my final offer. If we can't agree on this price, I'll have to consider other options.

I understand that you're willing to go up to $7900, Bob, but I'm still not comfortable selling it to you at that price. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and offer it to you for $8075. This is my final counteroffer. What do you think?
